pair.Prompt: What was the case of United States v. Joint Traffic Association about?
pair.Response: Response: United States v. Joint Traffic Association was a case about the legality of an agreement between railroads to establish uniform rates and to supplement the effort of the Interstate Commerce law to accomplish this. The prime object of the agreement was to take away the motives for competition and to secure neutrality in relation to the multitudinous competitions of life. The case was decided on October Term, 1898.
